intro: Ruschia punctulata, commonly known as the spotted ruschia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Ruschia punctulata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
